entry.title: SAP Support
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I need to raise a support incident regarding a java related error. But the SAP support portal does not accept my company or client name as  a Customer name. Which means I cannot complete the mandatory fields to log the call.  How can I proceed?

entry.title: Re: Employee history import issue for Both EC and Manual Import Scenario
entry.content: @swagatikapanda Replying since you tagged me. I've never seen this message and don't I have time to try to replicate unfortunately. I think I would rather have them load the full year through import here instead of doing a bit of both. Run the EC emp history job, export its data, load it into the employee history import file that captures the Jan 1 - April 1 period. Less confusing and full backup ready to reimport in case anything happens. Next year they can leverage full integration.

entry.title: Dynamic Template Download Upload Report on Year
entry.content:
Recantly , I was working on an requirement and sharing the same.

We need to develop a program to upload the Monthly Production plan. In input screen user will enter the year and execute we should get an excel template downloaded with columns Matnr , Plant and followed month of year. Upload function we will fill those details and upload will be saved to custom table and we need to give runtime save in alv(editable).

we will get year as input then we generate this template, and we will upload the same but there is twist we will upload data column-wise, but we need to update it row-wise here,

A010, B2, 1000, 2025, 01(Jan) this will one record in same way we will update all 12 records with respect to first row as A010, B2, 30, 2025, 12(Dec) in custom table.

Example:

PlantModel name25-Jan25-Feb25-Mar25-Apr25-May25-Jun25-Jul25-Aug25-Sep25-Oct25-Nov25-Dec
A010B21000400300500500300200500500604030
A010B32004003005005003002005005006040200
A010B45004003005005003002005005006040400
A010B53004003005005003002005005006040600

Difficult things to do in this task:

  • Generating the excel template on year (but we can do it easily). 
  • Handling uploaded data where in this requirement we need to update data row-wise in the system.
  • Selection Screen Design (Easy).

Simple Implementation: 

REPORT zztest_download_upload.

TABLES: sscrfields.
TYPE-POOLS: truxs.

TYPES: BEGIN OF tp_data,
         col1  TYPE string,
         col2  TYPE string,
         col3  TYPE string,
         col4  TYPE string,
         col5  TYPE string,
         col6  TYPE string,
         col7  TYPE string,
         col8  TYPE string,
         col9  TYPE string,
         col10 TYPE string,
         col11 TYPE string,
         col12 TYPE string,
         col13 TYPE string,
         col14 TYPE string,
       END OF tp_data.

TYPES: BEGIN OF tp_heading,
         heading(30),
       END OF tp_heading.

DATA: gt_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gf_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gv_data     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_data,
      gd_data     TYPE tp_data,
      gs_data     TYPE tp_data,
      gt_heading  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tp_heading,
      gs_heading  TYPE tp_heading,
      gt_fieldcat TYPE TABLE OF slis_fieldcat_alv,
      gs_fieldcat TYPE slis_fieldcat_alv,
      lv_date     TYPE string,
      lv_month    TYPE string,
      lv_year     TYPE string,
      lv_new_date TYPE string,
      lv_index    TYPE sy-tabix,
      lv_cell     TYPE string,
      index       TYPE I.
DATA : gs_prod_plan TYPE zzmm_m_prod_plan.

FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_cell>    TYPE string,
               <fs_input>   TYPE  tp_data,
               <fs_input_1> TYPE  tp_data,
               <fs_month>   TYPE tp_data,
               <fs_value>   TYPE any,
               <fs_value_1> TYPE any.
DATA : lv_field               TYPE char5,
       gv_model               TYPE mname,
       gv_plant               TYPE mcode,
       gv_filename            TYPE string,
       gv_path                TYPE string,
       gv_fullpath            TYPE string,
       gv_result              TYPE i,
       gv_template_downloaded TYPE abap_bool VALUE abap_false,
       it_raw                 TYPE truxs_t_text_data,
       gv_year                TYPE char4.

*INITIALIZATION.
*  gv_year = sy-datum+0(4).

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-001.
  PARAMETERS: rb_down RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp DEFAULT 'X' USER-COMMAND rb-s1,
              rb_up   RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b2 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
  PARAMETERS: s_file TYPE rlgrap-filename MODIF ID sc2.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b2.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b3 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
  SELECT-OPTIONS: p_model  FOR gv_model MODIF ID sc1 .
  PARAMETERS: p_plant  TYPE mcode MODIF ID sc1 .
  PARAMETERS: p_year  TYPE t009b-bdatj OBLIGATORY.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b3.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
  IF rb_down = 'X'.
    LOOP AT SCREEN.
      IF screen-group1 = 'SC2'.
        screen-invisible = 1.
        screen-input = 0.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'SC1'.
        screen-invisible = 0.
        screen-input = 1.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ELSE.
    LOOP AT SCREEN.
      IF screen-group1 = 'SC2'.
        screen-invisible = 0.
        screen-input = 1.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ELSEIF screen-group1 = 'SC1'.
        screen-invisible = 1.
        screen-input = 0.
        MODIFY SCREEN.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.


AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR s_file.
  CALL FUNCTION 'F4_FILENAME'
    EXPORTING
      field_name   = 'S_FILE'
      program_name = sy-cprog
    IMPORTING
      file_name    = s_file.


START-OF-SELECTION.
  IF rb_down = 'X'.
    PERFORM build_headings.
    PERFORM get_save_location.
    PERFORM download.
  ELSEIF rb_up = 'X'.
    PERFORM build_headings.
    PERFORM upload_file.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  GET_SAVE_LOCATION
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM get_save_location.
  CONCATENATE 'Template_' sy-datum sy-uzeit INTO gv_filename.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_save_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title      = 'Select the location'
      default_extension = 'xls'
      default_file_name = gv_filename
    CHANGING
      filename          = gv_filename
      path              = gv_path
      fullpath          = gv_fullpath
      user_action       = gv_result.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  BUILD_HEADINGS
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM build_headings.
  gs_heading-heading = 'Plant'.
  APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
  CLEAR gs_heading.

  gs_heading-heading = 'Model name'.
  APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
  CLEAR gs_heading.

  DATA: lt_month_names LIKE TABLE OF t247.
  CALL FUNCTION 'MONTH_NAMES_GET'
    TABLES
      month_names = lt_month_names
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS      = 1.

  LOOP AT lt_month_names INTO DATA(ls_month_name).
    CONCATENATE ls_month_name-ltx '' P_year INTO DATA(lv_header).
    gs_heading-heading = lv_header.
    APPEND gs_heading TO gt_heading.
    CLEAR gs_heading.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  DOWNLOAD
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM download.
  LOOP AT p_model INTO DATA(s_model).
    gs_data-col1 = p_plant.
    gs_data-col2 = s_model-low.
    APPEND gs_data TO gt_data.
    CLEAR : gs_data.
  ENDLOOP.
  IF gv_fullpath IS NOT INITIAL.
    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_DOWNLOAD'
      EXPORTING
        filename   = gv_fullpath
        filetype   = 'DAT'
      TABLES
        data_tab   = gt_data
        fieldnames = gt_heading
      EXCEPTIONS
        OTHERS     = 22.

    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      gv_template_downloaded = abap_true.

      CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>execute
        EXPORTING
          document = gv_fullpath
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS   = 10.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       Form  UPLOAD_FILE
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM upload_file.

  CALL FUNCTION 'TEXT_CONVERT_XLS_TO_SAP'
    EXPORTING
      i_tab_raw_data       = it_raw
      i_filename           = s_file
    TABLES
      i_tab_converted_data = gt_data
    EXCEPTIONS
      conversion_failed    = 1
      OTHERS               = 2.

  IF sy-subrc = 0.
    LOOP AT gt_heading INTO DATA(lv_fieldname).
      CLEAR: lv_field,gs_fieldcat.
      lv_field = |COL{ sy-tabix }|.
      gs_fieldcat-fieldname = lv_field."lv_fieldname.
      gs_fieldcat-seltext_l = lv_fieldname.
      gs_fieldcat-col_pos = sy-tabix.
      gs_fieldcat-ctabname = 'gt_data'.
      gs_fieldcat-edit = 'X'.
      APPEND gs_fieldcat TO gt_fieldcat.
    ENDLOOP.

    gv_data = gt_data.
    DELETE gv_data  INDEX 1.
    gf_data = gv_data.


    LOOP AT gv_data ASSIGNING <fs_input>.
      READ TABLE gt_data INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <fs_month>.
      index = 1.
      DO 12 TIMES.
        ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_input> TO <fs_value>.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          CLEAR gs_prod_plan.
          gs_prod_plan-mcode   = <fs_input>-col1.
          gs_prod_plan-mname   = <fs_input>-col2.
          gs_prod_plan-zplan = <fs_value>.
          gs_prod_plan-zmonth = index.
          gs_prod_plan-zyear = p_year.
          MODIFY zzmm_m_prod_plan FROM gs_prod_plan.
        ENDIF.
        index = index + 1.
      ENDDO.
    ENDLOOP.

    CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
      EXPORTING
        i_callback_program       = sy-repid
        i_callback_pf_status_set = ' '
        i_callback_user_command  = 'SAVE'
        i_default                = 'X'
        i_save                   = 'S'
        it_fieldcat              = gt_fieldcat
      TABLES
        t_outtab                 = gv_data
      EXCEPTIONS
        program_error            = 1
        OTHERS                   = 2.


    MESSAGE 'File uploaded and data captured successfully.' TYPE 'S'.
  ELSE.
    MESSAGE 'Error uploading file.' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

FORM save USING rcomm TYPE sy-ucomm
      sel TYPE slis_selfield.

  CASE sy-ucomm.
    WHEN '&DATA_SAVE'.
      LOOP AT gv_data ASSIGNING <fs_input>.
        READ TABLE gt_data INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <fs_month>.
        READ TABLE gf_data INTO gd_data INDEX sy-tabix.
        IF <fs_input> NE gd_data.
          DO 12 TIMES.
            ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_input> TO <fs_value>.
            ASSIGN COMPONENT sy-index + 2 OF STRUCTURE <fs_month> TO <fs_value_1>.
            DATA: lv_date_string TYPE string,
                  lv_month_num   TYPE char2,
                  lv_day         TYPE char2,
                  lv_month_name  TYPE string.

            lv_date_string = <fs_value_1>.

            SPLIT lv_date_string AT '/' INTO lv_month_num lv_day lv_year.

            IF sy-subrc = 0.
              CLEAR gs_prod_plan.
              gs_prod_plan-mcode   = <fs_input>-col1.
              gs_prod_plan-mname   = <fs_input>-col2.
              gs_prod_plan-zplan = <fs_value>.
              gs_prod_plan-zmonth = lv_month_num.
              gs_prod_plan-zyear = lv_year.
              MODIFY zzmm_m_prod_plan FROM gs_prod_plan.
            ENDIF.
          ENDDO.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
  ENDCASE.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Re: Not able to Copy Dataset to Planning Model and Vice V...
entry.content:
In SAP Analytics Cloud, copying data between a dataset and a planning model and vice versa is not supported directly through standard data actions because data actions work only between planning models. Datasets and planning models are different object types, and SAC does not provide out-of-the-box functionality to copy data bi-directionally between them.

Below are options to handle the scenario you described:

  • Use Data Actions to copy data between planning models only, not datasets. You can create a planning model from the dataset as a one-time step and then use data actions between planning models.
  • For copying data from a dataset to a planning model in recurring processes, you may export data from the dataset and then import it into the planning model manually or via scripts.
  • Alternatively, consider building an Analytical Application in SAC that programmatically manages data movement between dataset and models.
  • Use the SAC Data Export Service for replication scenarios between models but not directly for dataset-to-model copying.

In summary, direct bi-directional data copy between SAC datasets and planning models is not out-of-box supported; workarounds involve export/import or custom analytical apps.

For detailed guidance, see:

SAP Community question discussing dataset to model data copy limitations and workarounds

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Understanding Your Workforce Spending: The "Buckets of Spend" Approach
entry.content:
Understanding Your Workforce Spending: The "Buckets of Spend" Approach üí∞

When it comes to managing a business, one of the biggest and most complex expenses is your workforce. It‚Äôs not just about salaries; it's a vast ecosystem of costs that can be difficult to track. To get a handle on where your money is going, it's helpful to think in terms of "buckets of spend." This approach organizes all workforce-related expenses into major categories, giving you the clarity needed to make smarter, more strategic decisions.

The Key Buckets of Workforce Management Spend

Think of these buckets as the primary containers for every dollar you spend on your people.

1. Direct Costs

These are the most obvious expenses and form the foundation of your labor budget.

  • Salaries and Wages: The base pay for all your full-time, part-time, and contingent workers.

  • Benefits: This includes health insurance, retirement contributions, paid time off, and other employee perks.

  • Payroll Taxes: Mandatory contributions to programs like Social Security and unemployment.

  • Labor-Related Expenses: Overtime pay, shift differentials, and any other costs directly tied to employee hours.

2. Indirect Costs

These are the expenses that enable your workforce to function effectively but aren't part of their direct compensation. They are often overlooked but can add up significantly.

  • Recruitment Costs: From job board ads and agency fees to the time your team spends interviewing, every part of the hiring process has a cost.

  • Training and Development: The budget for onboarding new hires, professional development courses, and upskilling your existing team.

  • Administrative Costs: The time and resources your HR and operations teams spend on managing payroll, data, and compliance.

  • Technology Costs: Licensing fees for HR software (like Workday or BambooHR) and other tools your employees need to do their jobs.

3. Opportunity/Lost Time Costs

This bucket represents the money you lose due to inefficiency or downtime. It's often invisible on a spreadsheet but has a major impact on your bottom line.

  • Vacancies and Turnover: When a position is empty, you're not just saving on salary; you're losing the productivity that person would have contributed. High turnover means you're constantly losing institutional knowledge and spending money on recruiting.

  • Non-Productive Time (Shrinkage): This includes paid time that isn't spent on core work, such as idle time in a contact center, extended breaks, or gaps in schedule adherence.

4. Contingent and Flexible Workforce Costs

As more companies rely on freelancers, contractors, and temporary workers, this bucket is becoming increasingly important.

  • Payments to Non-Employees: This includes the fees paid to consultants, freelancers, and temporary agencies.

  • Administrative Overhead: The costs associated with managing third-party vendors and flexible work agreements.

A Deeper Look: Workforce Management IT & Technology Spend

Technology is no longer just an administrative tool; it's a core component of workforce management. This category deserves its own focus because it impacts every other bucket.

  • Hardware: Laptops, phones, and other devices provided to employees.

  • Software: Licensing for HRIS, payroll systems, and specialized workforce management platforms.

  • Infrastructure and Security: The costs to ensure your remote teams have secure access and the necessary support.

  • Ongoing Support: The budget for IT help, upgrades, and logistical support for your workforce's technology needs.

By breaking down your IT spend, you can see if you're over-investing in one area and under-investing in another, ensuring your tech stack truly supports your business goals.

Best Practices for Managing Your Spend

Simply identifying these buckets isn't enough. You need to actively manage them.

  1. Use Data to Inform Decisions: Don't rely on static budgets. Continuously audit your spending and adjust based on actual workforce needs and performance.

  2. Monitor for Inefficiencies: Are your recruitment times too long? Is there excessive administrative work? Map your spend to both direct and indirect costs to spot and fix these hidden drains.

  3. Regularly Review Your Cost Allocation: As your business evolves and your workforce mix changes (e.g., more remote workers, more contractors), your cost allocation should change, too.

By segmenting your workforce expenses into these buckets, you gain powerful visibility into where your labor costs are accruing. This allows you to make more informed decisions about where to optimize, invest, or reduce spend to build a more efficient and profitable organization.

Bruce Fischbach - Sr. Manager - Solution Value Advisory Fieldglass

Jennifer Lutters - Sr. Product Advocate SAP Fieldglass

entry.title: Re: Android.permission.READ_MEDIA_IMAGES and Android.perm...
entry.content: I am using SAP Build Apps Free to create an app that does not use any file, image, or video widgets. When I build the app for Android (APK/AAB), the following permissions are automatically included: READ_MEDIA_IMAGES READ_MEDIA_VIDEO This causes Google Play Console to flag the app with the message: "Your app uses undeclared photo and video permissions." I have checked all screens and widgets, and I do not have any File Upload, Camera, or Gallery widgets. It seems this is a default setting in the free version of SAP Build Apps. Question: Is there any way to remove these permissions in the free version? Is this a known limitation/bug in SAP Build Apps Free? Is there any workaround to upload the app to Google Play without these permissions being included? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Product Update: Batch Management in Service Orders
entry.content:
In one of my previous blog posts last year, I had covered a workaround approach on how to deal with using batch managed products in the service order process. Up till now, there was no integration which allowed the usage of batch managed products in the service order process.

With the release upgrade 2508, the usage of batch managed products is now supported in the service order process. In the service confirmation item for the batch-managed product, there is a field ‚ÄúBatch‚Äù now available, where the batch number of the product can be entered:

entry.title: Is it possible to create a sales order referencing another sales order from a different company code
entry.content:
We want to create a sales order referencing another sales order from a different company code or sales organization.

Even if we can change the sales org after it is created, that might work for us.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to create a sales order referencing an...
entry.content:
It is not possible to change the sales org field in the sales order. As you know it is greyed out.

The sales org cannot be different between the current and the referenced documents. I have copied the long text of the resulting error message below:

Sales organizations deviate from each other. & and/or & (reference)

Message no. V2007

Diagnosis

The sales organization of the reference document is not the same as the sales organization of the target document.

Procedure

If you want to add to an existing document by referring to another document, select a reference document with the same sales organization as the target document.
If you want to create a new document by referring to a document, make certain that the sales organization and the document number are correct.

---------

The behavior outlined in the following On-premise KBA is also accurate for S/4HANA Public Cloud:

 > 1601103    Contracts cannot be used across sales organisations

entry.title: Re: ConfifgÔºöDetermine Requirement Type by Item category C...
entry.content:
Hello  @ISoma 

Thanks for the screenshot.

SAP will not alter the mapping in Determine Requirement Type by Item Category SSCUI 105120 for TAN within a single tenant. Since this content is delivered and locked in Public Cloud, neither an incident nor an expert configuration will unlock it.

What you can currently do is supported.

Drive the requirement type from master data

    • Set Strategy Group / MRP Type in the product master.
    • Standard determination then picks the requirement type/class from the material‚Äôs planning strategy (this overrides the generic TAN fallback).

Use an alternative item category were allowed

    • If your scope allows, establish a Y* item category and assign it through item-category determination to the appropriate scenarios...
    • You still cannot edit 105120, but you can pair the Y-category with materials or schedule lines that produce the requirement type you need.

Model the business need via the schedule line and  planning strategy

    • Select MTS versus MTO behaviour through material planning settings so the system determines the correct requirements logic without tenant-specific changes.

Product change request (longer term)

    • If you need a different standard mapping for TAN, submit it via SAP Continuous Influence, as SAP does not supply one-off tenant mapping adjustments.

If you specify the exact behaviour you want, such as MTO for product X, no MRP reduction, or specific ATP logic, I‚Äôll propose a concrete combination of Strategy Group/MRP Type and  item/schedule line that achieves it without modifying 105120.

SAP Document References

  • SAP Help Portal - Central Business Configuration:
  • SAP Community - Clean Core Strategy:
  • SAP Help Portal - Item Category Determination:

entry.title: Integrated Financial Planning OPEX Cost Rates Data Action
entry.content:
Hey All, 

 

Could anyone help me understand a part of the standard IFP content?
In the Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation, under the Cost Rate section, there is a data action called ‚ÄúCalculate CCtr Activity Cost Rates with Account-Based Split‚Äù.

Within its code, I came across the following line, and I‚Äôm unsure of its purpose. When I try debugging, it shows empty values:

DATA([d/Measures] = #M2, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT]) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #M1)

 

FOR @Counter = 1 TO 100
IF [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] != "#" THEN
// Reset #COST for next iteration
DATA([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D", [d/Date] = #T1) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D", [d/Date] = #T1) * 0

entry.title: Re: SAC save data analyzer
entry.content:
@egil63 

Data Analyzer is a perfect option for adhoc data Analysis for an end user. 

  • If you are assigned to the creator or admin role, you can save an insight in the public or your private files.

  • If you are assigned to a viewer role, you can save an insight in your private files only. To do this an administrator can grant the private insight privilege to users with no create rights on the public or private files by creating a custom role and assigning the private insight privilege. With the private insight privilege, these users can also share and delete their insights however they can't edit or rename the insight in the file repository. For more information on creating custom roles, please see Create Roles.

  • You can save an insight to any workspace that you have access to

For permissions Refer to below.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/93fec5646f144e109745ce74fd492c3f.html#object-type-permissions

Hope this helps

Nikhil

entry.title: How to use key-user in-app Custom Logic extensibility to change eDocument currency in SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
Introduction

Some countries (like Colombia) might required to have reports sent to fiscal authority on their local currency even if the transaction was executed in a different currency and is registered on the system in a foreign currency. On  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition this requirement might be delivered in some localizations via extensibility as a localization as a Self-service to be implemented during implementation project.

Below example, shows how a sale in USD would be reported without the extensibility (left) and with extensibility solution (right):

Solution through Extensibility 

Based on a demand for Colombia invoice eDocument, we have developed the KBA 3648968.

On the KBA, we instruct how to find extension points (BAdIs) to change information in eDocument generated via eDocument Cockpit or Manage Electronic Documents apps. We also highlight that for each localization, it should be consulted the SAP Help Portal documentation for that localization to check which extension points are available and which should be used.

We also provide a proof-of-concept sample code that shows how the change for a XML file created for an eDocument for Colombia can be changed. Note that each localization and eDocument likely will have different extension points and limitation as well as each implementation might have its own requirements that will result on complete different code.

So each implementation should develop its own code and the KBA code is only an example and do not cover all scenarios nor is a final solution to be implemented.

Important Assets

The following documentation might be helpful to obtain more detailed information:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

    • SAP KBA 2805847 - eDocument Colombia Troubleshooting Guide (Topic B103)
    • SAP KBA 3648968 - Currency issues and Extensibility in Colombia eDocuments - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • SAP KBA 2974488 - Calculation errors in CUFE
    • SAP Help Portal:  Colombia App Extensibility
    • SAP Help Portal: Country/Region-Specific Functions
    • SAP Help Portal: Creating Implementations

This content was brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Customer Care Team

entry.title: Re: UIGEF001 maps in S4HANA 2023
entry.content:
Hi Elang234, 

Here's the answer in detail why we cannot support UIGEF001 in future release.

The SAP Geo Framework applications in component UIGEF001 are supported until S/4HANA 2021, with conditions.

New applications were created in S/4HANA 2021 in the default UI component UIS4HOP1 and are the preferred applications, with UIGEF001 applications only being used by existing customers during cutover from UIGEF001 to UIS4HOP1. Some customers may need time to migrate customer extensions to the new apps while running on an upgraded S/4HANA release. All these applications are based on the 3.x Esri JavaScript API.

In S/4HANA 2022 FPS1  SAP introduced new applications based on the Esri 4.x JavaScript API and will be the future Esri API platform for the Geo Framework. It is strongly suggested that customers move to these applications by S/4HANA 2023. Both 3.x and 4.x applications may be run in parallel during cutover. In a future release of S/4HANA the applications based on the 3.x API will be deprecated as Esri support for this API is ended. Here is the latest GEF Administration guide to follow.

Installation:

Follow the appropriate Master Guide for your implementation

  • 2383937 - SAP Geographical Enablement Framework - Installation & Upgrade Information Master Note (UIGEF001)
  • 3149622 - SAP Geographical Enablement Framework - Installation & Upgrade Information Master Note (UIS4HOP1)

It is strongly suggested that all UI support packages be implemented and subsequent notes applied to ensure correct functionality.

Ensure the applicable note for your UI component are implemented to avoid incorrect time entries when editing geometry.

  • 3409341 - [GEFUI] : Utilities UTC End Date Assignment Function Issue
  • 3419897 - [S4GEF] GEF_DATE_TO is populating with incorrect UTC format

Review note 2878649 - HANA Update to 1909 Fix for Data Type Date Fields Update. This will ensure your initial configuration is correct after an SAP BASIS level change.

Fully implement and test the base Geo Framework sample implementation before implementing EAM content.

  • Activate Business Function FND_GEF.
  • Ensure switch dependent BC sets are correctly activated. It may be some items are not fully activated due to system/client settings preventing the automated activation. Should this happen you will need to manually activate the dependent BC set for the switch.

After successfully testing the default configuration activate the EAM Business function.

  • Activate Business Function LOG_EAM_GEF.
  • Ensure switch dependent BC sets are correctly activated and manually activate if required.

Complete configuration for Database Connection as per online documentation. You should now have a basic working system to test.

Implementation:

Best practice suggests tables for each Business Object. This ensures the latest table deign and optimizations are in place. Implementation is performed using the following steps.

  • Using transaction GEF_CRT_TAB create tables for each of the EAM business objects. It is suggested to use a short prefix such as ‚ÄúNotif‚Äù for Notifications. A suffix is not required and the SRID can be included if desired.
  • Update the configuration for each Business Object to point to the relevant table/view prefix, remember to include the ‚Äú.‚Äù At the end. For example ‚ÄúNotif_3857.‚Äù
  • Should you wish to also use System level tables for non-EAM objects it is suggested to create new tables with the most current design using the same transaction, for example ‚ÄúSysGeom_3857.‚Äù . Update configuration for system configuration.

Because SAP does not know how a customer will translate their assets to map objects the delivered EAM configuration is an example of how EAM objects can be geo enabled. This configuration should be treated as an example and used as a guide for own implementations.

It is suggested that the most complex Geo Object be configured first and then used as a copy template for other Geo Objects. It is much easier to delete unwanted entries from the copy than manually add content, and then change the template configuration to suit each individual object.

Thanks,
Nick.

entry.title: Re: Issue in Fiori App Mass Maintenance of Bills of Mater...
entry.content:
Hi @nitin_desai_c79 

Thank you for your question.

The error you are experiencing means that the maximum threshold for simulation is being read as 0, even though you have maintained the control parameter in customizing.

To resolve the error, here is what you should check:

  1. Check your Business Role Authorization
    • Ensure the user has the correct Business Catalog assigned. For example, SAP_BOM_MASS_MAINT_PC or equivalent. Please note, if authorizations are incomplete, the system may not pick up the maintained threshold.
  2. Control Parameters for BoM (SSCUI / App)
    • In SSCUI 102543, the control parameters for Bill of Material, check that the parameter Maximum No. of BOMs for Mass Changes is indeed set to 1000.
    • Also confirm that this configuration is assigned to the correct plant/application area.
  3. Re-publish Settings
    • After updating the SSCUI, ensure you publish and re-test the app. Sometimes cached parameters are not picked up until a new session.

Please note that in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Simulation step uses a stricter threshold check than execution. If the threshold is not picked up, the system defaults to 0.

Mass Maintenance of Bills of Material Items

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Flexible workflow Steps ID (UUID) table details

Dear Chaitanya ‚Äå‚Äå

Have you tried SWPSTEPLOG ? It contains the detailed instance data of workflow steps, including step-level identifiers.

Related Tables for Context

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA - Map Format Data App - Conversion functi...
entry.content:
Hello @craigsnell 

Thanks for the question and the screenshot.

There is no official or complete descriptive index with examples covering all types of conversion functions. In the Map Format Data app. The list you see comes from the long-standing DMEE/DMEEX conversion function catalogue; Map Format Data reuses that library in S/4HANA Cloud.

SAP‚Äôs help covers how to use the app, but does not document each of the 400 functions one by one. SAP Help Portal   SAP Community

What you should do (recommendation)

  • App help/learning unit for the end-to-end process and where conversions fit. SAP Help Portal-Map Format Data for Payments  SAP Learning
  • The legacy DMEE catalogue serves as a reference for function semantics codes like CL, CR, C0, etc., such as left/right justification, excluding/replacing characters, and adding leading zeros. It is not specific to Cloud, but the meanings are consistent Carry over. LeanX Analytics

Practical tips

In the selection dialogue, use the search box to type words like left-justified, replace, exclude, leading zeros, date, etc., which quickly narrows down the list.

Build a sandbox mapping and test with sample data; save your picks as a template so your team reuses the same functions.

If you truly need an in-app index with examples, log it on SAP Continuous Influence; there‚Äôs no API or export of the catalogue in Public Cloud today.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP PS - AUC Settlement issue
entry.content:
Dear Shubham 

Have you tried the following steps?

A. Review and Correct the Investment Profile

Navigate to the Investment Profile (via OITA or WBS control tab).

Ensure the "Manage AUC" indicator is set.

Confirm that the Investment Profile is assigned to the correct Asset Class (one meant for automatic AUC creation; typically 4001 or its copy).

B. Ensure WBS Is Configured Properly

In transaction CJ20N, open the WBS element.

Under the Control Data tab:

Confirm that the Investment Profile is correctly assigned.

The WBS element should be of type AUC.

When properly configured, releasing the WBS will automatically generate the AUC and link it appropriately.


Release the WBS to trigger the correct AUC creation with a valid origin link.

C. If Incorrect AUC Already Exists

Delete the Investment Profile from the WBS:

This action should delete the incorrectly created AUC.

Reassign the correct Investment Profile.

Release the WBS again to generate a new, correctly linked AUC.

 

D. Check Asset (AUC) Origin Tab

In the Asset master‚Äôs Origin tab, verify that the WBS element appears in the correct field (instead of a PR number).

If it's still wrong, confirm that your configuration edits are saved and that system statuses are active.

 

Best regards

entry.title: Re: F3567 Maintenance costs analysis is not available in...
entry.content:
Hello @joezuehlcke11 

App F3567 Actual Maintenance Cost Analysis is visible in the SAP Fiori Apps Library but it is not directly assigned to any standard Enterprise Asset Management scope item. That is why you don‚Äôt see it in your activated scope.

Here is how you can activate it and make it available:

  1. You need to check your Business Catalog Assignment. In Public Cloud, apps are enabled via Business Catalogs, not scope items alone. For F3567, check the catalog SAP_EAM_BC_MAINTPLN_ANALYTIC_PC or similar depending on release. Assign this catalog to a business role for your Maintenance Planner.
  2. Verify Business Role Template. To do this, use the Business Role Template SAP_BR_MAINTENANCE_PLANNER. Then add the catalog for Actual Maintenance Cost Analysis if not already included.
  3. Note that no Separate Activation Needed. Since this is a Fiori analytical app (powered by CDS views), there is no additional configuration or activation required in Public Cloud. Once the correct role/catalog is assigned, the app becomes visible.

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: From Reactive to Preventative: SAP Support‚Äôs Next Chapter
entry.content:
Digital transformation raises the stakes for performance and uptime. That‚Äôs why SAP support is evolving from fast issue resolution to proactive prevention - powered by automation and agentic AI.

Watch the video to see how we combine always-on monitoring, intelligent risk detection, and expert guidance to keep your business running smoothly.

What‚Äôs changing and why it matters:

  • Automated agents continuously scan SAP environments to spot misconfigurations, incorrect usage, or emerging risks.
  • Machine learning predicts peak demand and flags potential bottlenecks before they impact users.
  • Identified risks are turned into actionable ‚Äúrisk objects,‚Äù categorized, and routed to the right mitigation path.
  • Non-critical issues can be auto-mitigated by AI, while customers or partners are engaged when action is required.
  • For complex or critical situations, SAP support experts step in with hands-on guidance.

This preventative strategy isn‚Äôt theory - it‚Äôs proven. With round-the-clock control room support, real-time monitoring, and proactive risk management, SAP Commerce Cloud achieved 100% uptime during the most demanding events of the year: Black Friday and Cyber Monday.

Our commitment remains the same: deliver exceptional support, earn your trust, and drive meaningful business impact through continuous improvement. AI helps us detect and predict; our experts help you resolve and optimize. Together, we turn insights into a seamless customer experience.

Press play to learn how SAP Support brings innovation and reliability together - so you can move faster with confidence.

entry.title: SAP Solution Extension (SolEx) partner solution - Top 10 reasons for SAP Customers
entry.content:
Here are 10 customer-facing advantages of choosing an SAP Solution Extension (SolEx) partner solution:

  1. Single contract and invoice with SAP
    You buy the solution from SAP under SAP‚Äôs standard commercial framework (often on the SAP price list/SAP Store). This simplifies procurement, vendor onboarding, legal review, and renewals, and can align with your existing SAP agreements (e.g., co-termination, enterprise/RISE constructs)

  2. One support channel via SAP
    Incidents are opened through SAP‚Äôs Support Launchpad and handled under SAP‚Äôs coordinated support model, with seamless transfer to the partner‚Äôs experts when needed. You get ‚Äúone face to the customer‚Äù for issue resolution, SLAs, and escalation.

  3. Jointly aligned roadmap and release management
    SAP and the partner coordinate roadmaps so the solution remains compatible with current and upcoming SAP releases (e.g., S/4HANA, BTP). This de-risks upgrades and ensures timely support for new SAP features.

  4. Assured integration and quality
    SolEx solutions undergo SAP qualification/certification, architecture reviews, and integration testing. You benefit from pre-validated integrations, reference architectures, and lower implementation risk.

  5. Upgrade safety and lifecycle assurance
    The partner and SAP align maintenance windows, APIs, and dependency management. This reduces regression issues during SAP upgrades or transformations (e.g., to S/4HANA or RISE with SAP).

  6. Faster time-to-value
    Prebuilt content, best practices, and accelerators‚Äîoften packaged specifically for SAP landscapes‚Äîshorten implementation time and reduce customization effort.

  7. Security, compliance, and operational rigor
    Solutions are reviewed against SAP‚Äôs security and quality baselines. You gain documented controls, audit-ready artifacts, and confidence in performance, security, and data protection alignment.

  8. Global reach and consistent delivery
    SAP‚Äôs global sales and support coverage means access to multilingual support, regional expertise, and consistent delivery standards across countries and business units.

  9. Commercial predictability and lower TCO
    Consolidated contracting and support reduce vendor sprawl and integration costs. Predictable maintenance, co-termed renewals, and standardized metrics help control total cost of ownership.

  10. Joint governance and escalation
    You can leverage coordinated governance (e.g., executive sponsorship, steering committees, Q-gates) across SAP and the partner. Escalations are streamlined with clear ownership and accountability.

entry.title: Re: Maintenance Planning for SAP Integration
entry.content:
Hi @Gilberto_Onesti 

In SAP Integration Suite (CPI) there is no annual maintenance calendar app like in SAP S/4HANA Maintenance Management. Instead do the following.

  1. Planned Maintenance Windows for CPI
    • SAP publishes planned maintenance schedules for Integration Suite tenants via the SAP Trust Center
    • There, you can filter for your region and service (Cloud Integration / Integration Suite) to see planned downtime or maintenance events.
  2. For customer notifications, any upcoming maintenance that affects your tenant is communicated through the SAP for Me portal (System Notifications) or via email notifications if you are registered as a contact.
  3. The annual calendar concept exists in S/4HANA Cloud Maintenance Management (for technical objects, orders, etc.). In Integration Suite, you only have planned maintenance announcements, not a configurable annual calendar in the system itself.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Unable to Print Terms & Conditions in Multiple Languages
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

We are unable to arrange printing of Terms & Conditions (T&C) in multiple languages on Customer Invoice output forms in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. T&C text was maintained in Manage Texts / Manage Logos apps in EN, DE, and FR.

 

In the output form (Adobe form), only the EN text prints correctly. Other language versions (DE, FR) are not being picked, or when they do, the formatting is lost.

 

Expected: System should pick the T&C text in the output language of the billing document, similar to how logos are determined via Manage Logos app. All maintained languages should print correctly in customer-facing forms.

 

Actual: Only EN version prints properly. For other languages, text is either missing or formatting is broken.

 

Business Impact: Legal T&C cannot be delivered to customers in their local language, which is a compliance and customer communication issue.

 

So requesting your help to please confirm if multi-language T&C printing via Manage Texts/Manage Logos apps is supported. Provide resolution or guidance on how to correctly arrange T&C texts per language in output forms. 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Print Terms & Conditions in Multiple Languages
entry.content:
In the current release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Manage Texts app allows maintaining text entries in several languages. However, unlike logos, the system does not automatically pick up the maintained translations into the billing output form. The printing of multi language T&Cs requires that the custom form template explicitly binds the corresponding text objects for each language version.

In your case, the English text appears correctly, while the DE/FR versions are not being rendered. This indicates that the form template (Adobe LiveCycle Designer) is only retrieving the EN text. The formatting issues you observed are also typically related to the text field setup in the template. 

I'd recommend you to reviewing your custom form template and adjusting the text field binding so it dynamically picks up the text according to the language of the billing document, and also ensuring that the text fields are set to support formatted (rich) text in Adobe LiveCycle Designer. 

Here are the list of KBAs and SAP Help Portal documentation to guide you: 

  • 0002679030 - Extensibility for Billing Document Printout - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • How to Extend a Custom Form Template for Billing Output with Custom Fields
  • Extensibility for Output Forms and Email Templates of Billing Documents
  • 0003251818 - Displaying Amount and Currency in Form Templates - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (same scenario is similar with currency/amount)
  • 2984817 - Form design in Adobe LiveCycle Designer
  • Adobe Help - Formatting field values and using patterns
  • SAP Help Portal - Form Templates - Locales
  • Setting Up Output Management (1LQ)

entry.title: Let‚Äôs Talk About Clean Core
entry.content:
What is Clean Core?

In simple terms: Clean Core is the practice of keeping the core of SAP S/4HANA as ‚Äúclean‚Äù and standardized as possible.

This means avoiding heavy customizations directly in the system core and, instead, using extensions, APIs, and official tools provided by SAP. By doing so, your company can:

  • Upgrade the system with less effort.

  • Reduce maintenance costs.

  • Adopt innovations much faster.

üëâ More details here: SAP Clean Core Methodology

Why is this important?

In SAP ECC, it was common for companies to change the central code to meet specific needs. The result? A heavy, rigid system ‚Äî expensive to upgrade and always slowing down the move to the cloud.

Clean Core was born to break this cycle. It allows your company to take advantage of SAP‚Äôs continuous updates without the ‚Äúheadaches,‚Äù while staying agile enough to innovate.

A Simple Analogy: Tidying Up the House

Think about it like this:

  • If you organize your house the way Marie Kondo suggests ‚Äî everything in its place ‚Äî it‚Äôs much easier to keep order every day.

  • But if you only tidy up when guests arrive, you‚Äôll spend way more time and energy, and probably still leave things out of place.

Clean Core works the same way: you keep the system organized from the start, instead of ‚Äúfixing things‚Äù only when a new upgrade or version migration arrives.

So, Where Should You Customize?

Here‚Äôs the strategic insight: not everything needs customization.

Accounting reports, tax invoices, legal requirements‚Ä¶ these are standardized and can follow SAP‚Äôs market-ready models, especially in the Cloud Public Edition.

That frees up time and budget for what really matters: the processes that differentiate your business and make customers choose you.

And it‚Äôs there ‚Äî in these unique areas ‚Äî that you should apply business intelligence and customizations, using the right S/4HANA tools (such as in-app extensions or side-by-side developments on SAP BTP).

In Summary

Clean Core is more than a technical recommendation. It‚Äôs a system management philosophy:

  • Keep what is standard truly standard.

  • Customize only where your competitive advantage lies.

  • Always think about why your company exists and the value it delivers to customers.

That way, every update will be smooth, every innovation easier to adopt, and the company‚Äôs focus will remain on what creates real market impact.

entry.title: Re: Guidance on Assignment Profile Updates for Revised Item
entry.content:
Hi @smulligan 

Regarding the first topic: "To ensure future assignments use the latest version without triggering notifications, should I update the assignment profile to include the new item revision, or can I retain the old version on the assignment profile and set the new version as a substitute to the old version?"

  • Well, it depends... Is the first version is still active? Will your company keep assigning the original version, even though there is an updated item version?

And regarding "I disabled the learning plan notification job before making changes, then re-enabled it afterward, but notifications were still sent. Is there a recommended approach to prevent this?"

  • This can be done. More details can be found on KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/0002372450

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway
entry.content:
Honestly, this change is very disruptive for everyone with multiple S- and P-users. Custom tags I gave these accounts to recall which account to use in what context are gone as well. Forcing me to go through my email archives to figure out which S-User to use to create a ticket for that one project.

Additionally, SSO does not work anymore between services. And most of my attempts to log in with my email end up in some obscure error message until I realize, yes, right, we need to use the user IDs again.

entry.title: List Prices from Microsoft Excel Not Working As Expected
entry.content:
Attempted to upload Supplier List Prices via List Prices from Microsoft Excel in the Product Portfolio - List Prices Work View. Clicked "New" button and selected "List Prices from Microsoft Excel". Expected a window to appear to enable the selection of an Excel file to upload containing Supplier Prices for import. Instead an Excel file was exported and downloaded, this was not the expected behavior. We have not experienced issues with Load from Excel in other Work Views. Please confirm that List Prices from Microsoft Excel is intended for Supplier Price imports and not downloads as it is currently doing? 

--- Steps to Reproduce ---
1. In the search bar enter "List" to display Product Portfolio and select List Prices
2. Under Product Portfolio - List Prices - Active List Prices, Select a Released Price List and press "New" button
3. Select List Prices from Microsoft Excel

Best Regards.



*Note To SAP:
I give approval for SAP Support to use these Steps to Reproduce, while connected to my impacted non-production environments, even if the steps result in a change being made and my approval remains valid until the issue is resolved, unless I inform SAP Support otherwise.

--- Issue Date (UTC) ---
DIGITS-09-03 17:01:39


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: List Prices from Microsoft Excel Not Working As Expected
entry.content:
Hello,

This is the correct behavior for List Prices, the button will always download a fresh template so you can edit and then send it back to the system. To be able to add a new List Price on system using Microsoft Excel is necessary to install the Add-In for Microsoft Excel, and then upload using the Save data to button. For this you can follow the below steps:

Firstly, install the SAP Add-In for Microsoft Excel by following the below steps:

Go to the Application and User Management work center.
Enter the Download Center view.
Click on the download icon for SAP Add-In for Microsoft Excel.
After the download, execute the installer on your machine.
Once the installation is successfully completed, a new tab SAP BUSINESS BYDESIGN will be available in the excel workbook. 

Follow the below steps to Import List Prices via Excel:

Open the Microsoft Excel workbook.
Go to the tab SAP BUSINESS BYDESIGN and log into the desired system using the Logon option available. Enter the tenant URL, Username and password to login. 
Go to Product Portfolio work center and navigate to List prices view.
Click on New and choose the option List prices from Microsoft Excel. 
This will download the template for importing the List prices in the Excel. 
Open the downloaded template in Microsoft Excel.
Enter all the relevant details.
Go to SAP BUSINESS BYDESIGN tab and click on the option Save data to. 
This will successfully import the List prices data into the system. 
Navigate to UI to check the List price details. 
Hope this clarifies your questions.

In case you have any further questions or issues, please reach out to me and I'll be glad to help.‚Ä®Otherwise please complete the incident and reply to our SAP Support Satisfaction Survey and share with me what you enjoyed the most about the experience you had with my work.‚Ä®
Once you complete the incident, you will be redirected to the survey and this will help me to always deliver a great support.‚Ä®

Thanks,‚Ä®
Di√©ssica‚Ä®
SAP Support‚Ä®

Event-Based CDS Views for Manufacturing Orders
